PageTitle: mpls te bandwidth (SR Tunnel interface view)
FuncDef:
The mpls te bandwidth command is used to configure the bandwidth constraint of an MPLS TE tunnel.
The undo mpls te bandwidth command is used to restore the default bandwidth constraint of an MPLS TE tunnel.
By default, the tunnel has no bandwidth constraints.

ParaDef.Info:
CT Type.
The values are ct0, ct1, ct2, ct3, ct4, ct5, ct6 and ct7.

Bandwidth in CT.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4000000000, in kbit/s.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To make the tunnel up, you need to configure the tunnel bandwidth.
Precautions
The parameters cr1 to ct7 are only used in DS-TE scenarios.
